* BrightBlade nodded as she received Rampage�s transmission relieved that it 
had gotten through most of the energon interference.
She then nodded and sighed. *

� Good, Rampage. Make sure that you do. BrightBlade out.�

* And with that she deactivated her communicator and looked back to 
Perndabot, him not knowing that she had actually seen him nod but then try 
to recover. She shook her head with a smile. *

� You know, you can admit that you like me if that�s the case.�

* She saw him speed up but maintained her casual pace, still keeping up with 
him. The trees were thinning out and a vast plain could be seen in the 
distance, it would soon be time to execute her carefully thought up plan.
But somehow she guessed that she would not be able to get all of the 
information she would need, thinking of how the Maximals would detect her 
after half a mega-cycle or two. But for the sake of Predacon conquest she 
had to try. And if she failed she would judge in what she had done wrong the 
first time and then try it again, knowing that she knew before and knowing 
that she knew then.
But one never knows until they try.
BrightBlade looked down at Gangon�s spark, knowing that she wouldn�t be able 
to take it with her. Its signature would give her away.
But if she kept it with Perndabot and his own cloaking device it would 
remain unreadable.
She looked up at Perndabot, taking in a deep breath. *

� Would you mind if I left this spark with you? I can�t take it in with me.�
